info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 04 at 5:28PM EDT until May 04 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN MECKLENBURG...SOUTHEASTERN GASTON AND NORTHEASTERN YORK COUNTIES... At 528 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southwest of Uptown Charlotte, or near Southwest Charlotte, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Matthews, Fort Mill, Belmont, Pineville and Tega Cay. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
